summary.p: #42. a) PIM, main shrine; b) on the upper part (pattika) of the base of the western façade, on the central projection; c) personally located and read in situ; d) Tyagarajan (2014: no. 6, 121–123); e) lost regnal year of cālai kalam aṟutta Kōrājarājakesarivarman; f) Rājarāja I; g) inscription not read with anyone; h) on the middle part (kumuda), there are some unlegible remains of letters which may belong to the same inscription as in the case of #41 on the southern façade; the inscription is not contiuous and the edition is thus difficult to establish (the one established by Tyagarajan is quite confusing): there are three lines, but some stones are not engraved and one stone is missing.
